intro: Zannichellia palustris var. repens, commonly known as the running water plant, is a aquatic plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in shallow, slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds, ditches, and wet meadows. The plant has long, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface, while its roots are anchored in the substrate. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, contributing to its ornamental value. Zannichellia palustris var. repens is often used in pond landscaping due to its ability to help stabilize water ecosystems.
